definition: hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)

sentences.english: It is very often nothing but our own vanity that deceives us.
sentences.chinese: 我们往往会因为我们自己的虚荣心，而给弄迷了心窍。

sentences.english: We all need to use money but we need to be careful that we don't become tainted by it.
sentences.chinese: 我们都需要钱，但要小心不要因此而财迷心窍。

sentences.english: She had never been so crushed.
sentences.chinese: 她从来没有这么鬼迷心窍过。

sentences.english: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 于是耶稣开他们的心窍，使他们能明白圣经。

sentences.english: Nowadays, many girls seem to have a bee in their bonnets and they are determined to marry foreigners.
sentences.chinese: 最近许多女孩都鬼迷心窍似的一心只想嫁个外国人。

sentences.english: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures
sentences.chinese: 于是耶稣开他们的心窍，使他们能明白圣经。

sentences.english: She must have been possessed, to attack her own mother.
sentences.chinese: 她准是鬼迷心窍，竟然打自己的妈妈。

sentences.english: E. g. : Lisa is really monday hungry, who cares nothing but her wages.
sentences.chinese: 莉萨真是财迷心窍，一心只关心她工资。

sentences.english: There was a rumor saying the king was possessed by devils.
sentences.chinese: 有传闻说国王被魔鬼迷住了心窍。

sentences.english: 45Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 于是耶稣开他们的心窍，使他们能明白圣经。

sentences.english: Everything in our sight turns into the gold ingots.
sentences.chinese: 眼里看到的，什么都象元宝，真是个财迷心窍的民族。

sentences.english: You must either be mad or utterly depraved and wicked.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是疯了，要不就是中了邪，鬼迷心窍。

definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
potion that makes the soul forget its previous life/(fig.) words or actions intended to attract sb's interest
see 不知好歹[bu4 zhi1 hao3 dai3]
not understanding things (idiom); devoid of sense
variant of 糊塗|糊涂[hu2 tu5]
to lose one's head/to be out of one's mind/to be dazed
